skill.name: docs-validator
skill.description: Documentation quality validator for Logseq Template Graph. Checks documentation completeness, accuracy, formatting, links, and consistency. Activates when asked to "validate docs", "check documentation", "audit docs quality", "find broken links", or similar requests. Provides actionable feedback and specific fixes for documentation issues.

skill.author: C0ntr0lledCha0s

security_audit.summary: This is a pure prompt-based skill with no executable code. The SKILL.md file contains only documentation validation guidelines and example prompts for an AI assistant. No network calls, file writes, or command executions are performed by the skill itself.

content.value_statement: Documentation quality issues waste developer time and frustrate users. This skill scans your docs for completeness, broken links, formatting errors, and consistency problems, then provides actionable fixes with prioritized recommendations.
actual_capabilities: Scans all documentation files for completeness and coverage
Validates internal and external links for broken references
Checks markdown formatting including headers, code blocks, and tables
Analyzes documentation consistency across terminology and style
Generates detailed validation reports with prioritized recommendations
Tests code examples and commands for accuracy
limitations: Focused specifically on Logseq Template Graph documentation structure
Cannot fix issues automatically - provides recommendations for human review
External link validation requires network access via platform tools
Does not validate non-markdown documentation formats

use_cases.title: Pre-release documentation audit
use_cases.description: Run comprehensive audit before releases to ensure documentation meets quality standards and all features are documented

use_cases.title: Documentation contribution review
use_cases.description: Check new documentation submissions for completeness, formatting consistency, and working code examples before merging

use_cases.title: Ongoing quality monitoring
use_cases.description: Track documentation coverage over time, identify gaps in module documentation, and maintain consistent style across all docs

prompt_templates.title: Quick validation
prompt_templates.prompt: Validate the documentation in this project. Report the overall score, highlight the top 3 issues, and show coverage percentage for module READMEs.

prompt_templates.title: Link verification
prompt_templates.prompt: Check all documentation for broken links. List each broken link with its file location and line number, then suggest the correct path or URL.

prompt_templates.title: Full audit
prompt_templates.prompt: Run a full documentation audit. Check completeness, accuracy, formatting, links, and consistency. Generate a detailed report with severity levels and prioritized fixes.

prompt_templates.title: Coverage analysis
prompt_templates.prompt: Analyze module documentation coverage. List all modules, check for README files, report missing documentation, and suggest a priority order for creating missing docs.

output: Critical Issues: 2 (missing misc module docs, broken external link)
Top Priority: Create source/misc/README.md to document 82 classes

best_practices: Run quick validation checks before each documentation update to catch issues early
Perform full audits monthly and before major releases to maintain quality standards
Use the prioritized recommendations to focus on high-impact fixes first
anti_patterns: Skipping documentation validation and relying only on manual review
Ignoring broken internal links which confuse users navigating documentation
Accepting inconsistent terminology across different documentation sections

faq.question: What documentation formats does this skill support?
faq.answer: The skill validates markdown files. It checks all .md files in docs/, source/, and .claude/ directories.

faq.question: Can this skill fix broken links automatically?
faq.answer: No. The skill identifies broken links and suggests fixes, but requires human review and approval for changes.

faq.question: Does this skill work with private repositories?
faq.answer: Yes. The skill uses platform tools to read files. External link validation requires network access.

faq.question: How long does a full documentation audit take?
faq.answer: A full audit typically completes in under a minute for standard projects with hundreds of documentation files.

faq.question: Can I integrate this into CI/CD pipelines?
faq.answer: Yes. Use Claude Code CLI with this skill to run validation checks as part of automated build processes.

faq.question: What makes this different from other documentation tools?
faq.answer: This skill provides AI-powered analysis with context-aware recommendations tailored to Logseq Template Graph structure.
